9.title: Show & Tell : a Collection of Comics about Teaching & Learning
9.author: editorial board: Dan Mazur, Alexander Danner, Caitlin Plovnick, Michael Gianfrancesco.
notes: "Show and Tell was produced in conjunction with the first New England Comic Arts in the Classroom Conference, held in Providence in March, 2011. The book was created with the participation of the members of the Boston Comics Roundtable."

"Twenty-three independent comics creators take you into one of the most treacherous, unpredictable, and mundane territories of contemporary life: the classroom. The stories in Show and Tell explore the drama and humor of teaching and learning... or trying to teach and learn. From grade school, to high school, to college; from schools in America and England to Japan and Latin America; from the perspectives of both teachers and student, formal education proves to be fertile ground for fiction and non-fiction narratives in the comics medium."

74.heading: Showa.
74.title: Shigeru Mizuki's Showa : a History of Japan.
74.author: [No author]

75.heading: Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinju.
75.title: Descending Stories : Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinju
75.author: Haruko Kumota ; translator, Matt Alt.
notes: Summary (from publisher via OCLC): "A hapless young man is released from prison with nothing to his name, but he knows exactly what he wants: to train in the art of rakugo comedic storytelling. After seeing an unforgettable performance from one of Japan's greatest masters, Yakumo Yurakutei VIII, during his time in jail, he will settle for nothing less than to become apprentice to the best. Yakumo, notorious for taking no students, is persuaded to take him on, and nicknames him Yotaro, the fool. Yotaro has no formal training or elegance, but something about his charisma reminds Yakumo of someone from his past."

76.heading: "Shwa go Eika."
76.title: Trash Market
76.author: Tadao Tsuge ; edited & translated by Ryan Holmberg.

contents.title: Up on the hill top, Vincent van Gogh = Oka no ue de, vincento van gohho wa
Song of Shwa = Shwa go eika
Gently goes the night : Yoru yo yuruyaka ni
A tale of absolute and utter nonsense = Ktmukei dan

notes: "A man walks away from his desk and disappears for weeks, only to return with no recollection of his wanderings. A married war veteran wrestles with depression and befriends a young woman. A rebellion turns bloody. A young artist studies the life and paintings of Vincent van Gogh. A schoolboy faces violence and antipathy at home. A group of lowlifes tease and cajole each other as they wait their turn to sell blood to survive."

77.title: Showa, 1926-1939 : a History of Japan
77.author: Shigeru Mizuki ; translation by Zack Davisson.
notes: "First volume of Shigeru Mizuki's meticulously researched historical portrait of twentieth century Japan. This volume deals with the period leading up to World War II, a time of high unemployment and other economic hardships caused by the Great Depression. Mizuki's photo-realist style effortlessly brings to life Japan of the 1920s and 1930s, depicting bustling city streets and abandoned graveyards with equal ease."

78.title: Showa, 1939-1944 : a History of Japan
78.author: Shigeru Mizuki ; translation by Zack Davisson.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Continues Mizuki's autobiographical and historical account of Showa-era Japan. This volume covers the final moments of the lead-up to World War II and the first few years of the Pacific War, and is a chilling reminder of the harshness of life in Japan during this highly militarized epoch.

79.title: Showa, 1944-1953 : a History of Japan
79.author: Shigeru Mizuki ; translation by Zack Davisson.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): The third volume of Mizuki's encyclopedic account of Japan before and after World War II. Drawing from his own experiences as a foot soldier in the Pacific Islands and from the greater sweep of history's footprints, it is a chilling antiwar document and an intimate revelation of the destruction left in the wake of the atomic bombs.

219.title: Showcase Presents All-Star Squadron. Volume 1
219.author: written by Roy Thomas.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Justice League of America 193, All-Star Squadron 1-18."

220.title: Showcase Presents Blackhawk. Vol. one.
220.author: [No author]
notes: Originally published in single magazine form in Blackhawk, #108-127, 1957-1958.
Featuring the art team of Dick Dillin and Charles Cuidera.
"First assembled during World War II, the high-flying Blackhawk Squadron continued its heroic missions long after the defeat of the dreaded Axis alliance
and no menace was safe when locked in their thunderjets' sights...They are the finest aviators in the world

but the threats the Blackhawks face are otherworldly. With the dawning of the space age, the Blackhawks must battle deadly foes on vast new frontiers: radioactive monsters, giant robots, mad scientists, criminal conspiracies and more."

221.title: Showcase Presents Challengers of the Unknown. Volume one
221.author: writers, Dave Wood, Jack Kirby, and Ed Herron ; artists, Jack Kirby, et al.
221.genre: Science fiction and adventure story genres.
notes: Originally published in single magazine form in Showcase #6-7, 11-12 and Challengers of the Unknown #1-17.

222.title: Showcase Presents Enemy Ace. Volume one
222.author: all stories written by Robert Kanigher ; and all covers and stories pencilled and inked by Joe Kubert, unless otherwise noted.
notes: Originally issued in single magazine form as: Our army at war #151, 153, 155; Showcase #57-58; Star spangled war stories, #138-145, 147-150, 152, 181-183, 200; Detective comics #404; Men of war #1-3, 8-10, 12-14, 19-20; and, Unknown soldier, #251-253, 260-261, 265-267.

"Famed German fighter pilot Hans von Hammer has learned his lesson all too well, in countless battles high above the blasted fields of World War I Europe. Feared by his own men almost as much as he is hated by the Allies, Rittmeister von Hammer wages a lonely war from the cockpit of his crimson Fokker triplane, struggling to fight with honor amid the savagery of modern combat. But honor can be an expensive luxury in the unforgiving skies where the slightest mistake can bring a swift and merciless death, a fate that will, inevitably, claim even the Hammer of Hell himself!"

223.title: Showcase Presents Green Arrow, v. 1
223.author: Dick Wood, script ; Lee Elias, art
223.appears_in: 6 p. in World's Finest Comics, no. 123 (Feb. 1962) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents Green Arrow, v. 1 (2006).
notes: Summary: Prof. Marlo claims to be able to foretell disasters.
Appearances of Speedy, the Arrow Plane, and reporter Pete Sommers.
Data from Bob Hughes, Lou Mougin, Craig Delich at al. via Grand Comics Database.

224.title: Showcase Presents Green Lantern, no. 5
224.author: Denny O'Neil, story ; Neal Adams, art ; colors, Jack Adler

notes: Data from Bob Klein, Donald Dale Milne, Gregory Fischer, et al., via Grand Comics Database.

225.title: Showcase Presents Green Lantern, no. 5
225.author: / Elliot Maggin, writer ; Neal Adams and Dick Giordano, artists ; John Costanza, letters
225.appears_in: 13 p. in Green Lantern, no. 87 (Dec. 1971/Jan. 1972) ; reprinted in DC Special Blue Ribbon Digest, no. 23 (July 1982) ; reprinted in Green Lantern/Green Arrow, no. 6 (Mar. 1984) ; reprinted in Green Lantern/Green Arrow, no. 2 (2004) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents Green Lantern, no. 5 (2005).
notes: Summary: After Green Arrow witnesses the death of a young boy in a riot, he decides that he might be able to do more for his city as its mayor.
Appearances of Jack Major, Kevin McManus, Diana Drake Lance, Bruce Wayne, Hal Jordan, and Clark Kent.
Data from Bob Klein, Donald Dale Milne, Gregory Fischer, et al., via Grand Comics Database.

226.title: Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1
226.author: Michael L

227.title: Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1
227.author: John Albano, script ; Tony Dezuiga, art
227.appears_in: 16 p. in Weird Western Tales, no. 16 (Feb./Mar. 1973) ; reprinted in Jonah Hex and Other Western Tales, no. 2 (Nov./Dec. 1979) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1 (2005).
notes: Summary: Amy Gauwell hires Jonah to help the town sheriff capture the Scortch Donnigan gang. Unfortunately she doesn't know the sheriff is working with the gang.
Appearances of Clem, Josh, Mr. Gauwell, Luke Little (the sheriff), and Abner.
Data from Gene Reed, Jim Van Dore and Max Capp via Grand Comics Database.

228.title: Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1
228.author: John Albano, story ; Tony Dezuiga, art
228.appears_in: 17 p. in Weird Western Tales, no. 17 (Apr./May 1973) ; reprinted in Jonah Hex and Other Western Tales, no. 3 (Jan./Feb. 1980) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1 (2005).
notes: Summary: Jonah stops an old woman and her sons who were terrorizing a town.
Appearances of Ned and Kathy Haughton, Judge Hatchet, Daniel 'Dynamite' Delvin, Dynamite Delvin's gang, Tex, Clem, Willie, and Marty.
Data from Gene Reed, Jim Van Dore and Max Capp via Grand Comics Database.

229.title: Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1
229.author: John Albano, script ; Tony DeZuiga, art
229.appears_in: 23 p. in Weird Western Tales, no. 18 (July/Aug. 1973) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1 (2005).
notes: Summary: Jonah is framed for a con pulled by J.M. Marberry using an actor dressed up as a wolf-boy.
Appearances of Josh Schuyler, Sue Coursen, Clem, and Mr. Colby.
Data from Gene Reed, Jim Van Dore and Max Capp via Grand Comics Database.

230.title: Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1
230.author: Tony De Zuniga, illustrator ; John Albano, writer
230.appears_in: 12 p. in Weird Western Tales, no. 14 (Oct./Nov. 1972) ; reprinted in Jonah Hex and Other Western Tales, no. 3 (Jan./Feb. 1980) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1 (2005).
notes: Summary: Jonah is bushwhacked by two brothers who want revenge for Jonah killing their third brother. Jonah is staked out in the desert to die. Iron Jaws dies while rescuing Jonah.
Appearances of Jim (a doctor), Butcher, and Dan.
Data from Gene Reed, Jim Van Dore and Max Capp via Grand Comics Database.

231.title: Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1
231.author: John Albano, script ; Tony Dezuiga, art
231.appears_in: 14 p. in Weird Western Tales, no. 13 (Aug./Sept. 1972) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents Jonah Hex, no. 1 (2005).
notes: Summary: Jonah tries to help his friend Windy Taylor, who Fenrick is trying to drive off his land. Unfortunately Windy's son Tod is in cahoots with Fenrick.
Appearances of Iron Jaws, Josh Hally, Will, and Boone.
Data from Gene Reed, Jim Van Dore and Max Capp via Grand Comics Database.

238.title: Showcase Presents Martian Manhunter. Vol. 1
238.author: all stories written by Jack Miller and all art by Joe Certa, unless otherwise noted.
notes: Originally issued in single magazine form as: Batman 78, Detective Comics 225-304.

"After being accidentally teleported to Earth, Martian J'onn J'onzz finds himself stranded in a strange new world, with no way home. Using his powers to disguise his appearance, J'onn J'onzz adopts the name of deceased Denver police detective John Jones. With his new identity, he joins the Middleton Police force, secretly using his powers to help the inhabitants of Earth."

239.title: Showcase Presents Metal Men. Volume one
239.author: Robert Kanigher, editor (original series) ; Peter Hamboussi, editor (collected edition) ; all stories written by Robert Kanigher ; all stories and covers pencilled by Ross Andru and inked by Mike Esposito, unless otherwise noted.
notes: Originally issued between 1962 and 1963 in single magazine form as: Showcase #37-40; Metal Men #1-15; The Brave and the Bold #55.

240.title: Showcase Presents Metamorpho, the Element Man.
240.author: [No author]
notes: Originally published in single magazine form in Metamorpho 1-17, The Brave and the Bold 57, 58, 66, 68, and Justice League of America 42.

241.heading: Showcase Presents Rip Hunter Time Master.
241.title: Rip Hunter, Time Master. Volume 1.
241.author: [No author]
notes: Other title: Showcase Presents Rip Hunter Time Master.
"Originally published in single magazine form in Showcase 20-21, 25-26 ; Rip Hunter Time Master 1-15." 1961-1963.

242.title: Showcase Presents Shazam! Vol. 1
242.author: writers, Denny O'Neil, et al
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): A collection of the first 33 issues of the 1970's comics in which Billy Batson, an adolescent newscaster, is given god-like powers by the wizard SHAZAM and becomes Captain Marvel, the world's mightiest mortal!

243.title: Showcase Presents Strange Adventures. Volume one.
243.author: [No author]
notes: Originally issued in single magazine form as: Strange Adventures, 54-73, published 1955-1956.

244.title: Showcase Presents Superman. Vol. 1.
244.author: [No author]
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Action Comics 241-257 and Superman 122-134."

A collection of Superman comics that were originally published in 1959 through 1963. Includes the introduction of his first love, Lori Lemaris, and the appearance of Supergirl. The Man of Steel faces his most dangerous opponents, including Bizarro, Metallo, and Brainiac.
Cover title: DC Showcase Presents Superman.

245.title: Showcase Presents Superman. Vol. 2
245.author: writers, Jerry Coleman, et al
245.appears_in: ; pencils, Wayne Boring, et al. ; inks, Stan Kaye, John Sikela.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Action Comics 241-257 and Superman 122-134."

Summary (from SkyRiver): A collection of Superman comics that were originally published in 1959 through 1963. Includes the introduction of his first love, Lori Lemaris, and the appearance Supergirl. The Man of Steel faces his most dangerous opponents, including Bizarro, Metallo, and Brainiac.

246.title: Showcase Presents Superman. Vol. 3
246.author: writers, Robert Bernstein et al
246.appears_in: ; artists, Wayne Boring, et al. ; inkers, Stan Kaye, et al.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Action Comics 279-292, Superman Annual 3-4, and Superman 146-156."

Summary (from SkyRiver): A collection of Superman comics that were originally published in 1961 and 1962. Includes Superman's introduction of Supergirl to the world and the 1961 imaginary story "The Death of Superman."

247.heading: Showcase Presents Superman--Reviews.
247.title: "Our Hood Ornament"
247.author: by Tom Crippen
247.appears_in: p. 48-49 in The Comics Journal, no. 276 (June 2006).

248.title: Showcase presents Superman Family. Vol. one.
248.author: [No author]
notes: All stories written by Otto Binder and drawn by Curt Swan & Ray Burnley unless otherwise noted.
Originally published in single magazine form in Superman's Pal Jimmy Olsen 1-22, Showcase 9, and Superman 28, 1944 through 1957.

249.title: Showcase Presents Teen Titans. Volume two.
249.author: [No author]
notes: Originally issued in single magazine form as: Teen Titans 19-37, World's Finest Comics 205, The Brave and Bold 83,94.
"Robin, Kid Flash, Aqualad, Wonder Girl and Speedy

the terrific Teen Titans are back to fight injustice and help teenagers all over the world solve the problems that plague their generation. The super sidekicks gain some powerful new allies in their journey of justice as they are joined by battling brothers Hawk and Dove, the psychic Lilith and brave defender of the streets Mal Duncan."

250.title: Showcase Presents the Atom
250.author: all stories written by Gardner Fox ; all covers and stories pencilled by Gil Kane ; all covers inked by Murphy Anderson and all stories inked by Sid Greene ; unless otherwise noted.

contents.title: Vol. 1: Originally published in single magazine form in Showcase 34-36, The Atom 1-17
Vol. 2: Originally issued in single magazine form as: The Atom 18-38, issued 1965-1968.

notes: "Ivy University professor and scientist Ray Palmer discovers a mysterious meteorite giving him the ability to shrink his body to microscopic size. Fashioning a uniform from fibers taken from the meteorite, Dr. Palmer learned to control not only his size but also his mass, emerging as a mighty champion of justice and enemy of all evil as the hero called The Atom."

251.title: Showcase presents The Elongated Man. Volume one
251.author: writers, John Broome, Gardner Fox ; inkers Joe Giella, Murphy Anderson, Carmine Infantino ; artisits , Sid Greene, Neal Adams, Irv Novick.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Ralph Dibny is the Elongated Man, a self-taught super-hero who has harnessed the power of the exotic gingo fruit and attained the ability to stretch himself to fantastic lengths. Along with his wife Sue, Elongated Man travels the world to solve crimes, crossing paths with Batman and Robin, the Flash, Green Lantern and Zatanna!

252.title: Showcase Presents The Flash. Vol. 1
252.author: writers, Robert Kanigher, John Broome ; illustrators, Carmine Infantino
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Flash Comics 104, Showcase 4, 8, 13, 14, The Flash 105-119, 1949, 1956-1961."

Summary (from SkyRiver): A collection of some of the earliest adventures of Barry Allen as The Flash in which he faces Captain Cold, Mirror Master, Gorilla Grodd, and more. Originally published in 1949 and 1956-1961.

253.title: Showcase Presents The Flash. vol. 2
253.author: written by John Broome ; all covers and interior art pencilled by Carmine Infantino ; inked by Joe Giella.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in The Flash 120-140."

254.title: Showcase Presents the Green Arrow. Vol. 1
254.author: writers, Dave Wood, et al
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Adventure Comics 250-269, The Brave and the Bold 50, 71, 85, 136, 138, 140, Justice League of America 4, World's Finest comics 95-134, 136, 138, 140."
A collection of Green Arrow comics that were originally published in 1958 through 1969.

255.author: [No author]
notes: Lists: Walt and Skeezix ; Winsor McCay His Life and Art ; It's Superman ; The Stuff of Dreams ; Showcase Presents The Green Arrow, plus others with little annotation.

256.title: Showcase Presents The Haunted Tank. Vol. 1
256.author: stories by Robert Kanigher ; art by Russ Heath, et al.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in G.I. Combat #87-119, the Brave and the Bold #52, and Our Army at War #115, copyright 1961-1966."
"Reprints the first 33 hard-hitting tales of the Hunted Tank, plus a crossover with Sgt. Rock and Johnny Cloud and a Haunted Tank cameo appearance from Our Army at War."

257.title: Showcase Presents The House of Mystery. Vol. three.
257.author: [No author]
notes: Originally published 1968-1971 in single magazine form in The House of Mystery 212-226.

258.title: Showcase Presents The War that Time Forgot. Vol. 1.

260.title: Showcase Presents World's Finest, v. 2
260.author: Jerry Coleman, script ; Dick Sprang, pencils ; Sheldon Moldoff, inks
260.series: 2008) "The Incredible Team of Bat-Mite and Mr. Mxyzptlk"
260.appears_in: 13 p. in World's Finest Comics, no. 123 (Feb. 1962) ; reprinted in Showcase Presents World's Finest, v. 2 (2008).
notes: Summary: Mxyzptlk and Bat-Mite discover that when they use their magic together they can't control the outcome.
Appearances of Kryptonite, The Crime Rocket, and Robin.
Data from Bob Hughes, Lou Mougin, Craig Delich at al. via Grand Comics Database.
